questions.question: What is the core of Harry Potter's wand?
questions.answer: Phoenix feather (specifically, a feather from Fawkes, Dumbledore's phoenix)

questions.question: What potion does Hermione successfully brew in their second year that requires a month to prepare?
What is the name of Ron Weasley's pet rat?
questions.answer: Scabbers (later revealed to be Peter Pettigrew)

questions.question: What platform at King's Cross Station do students use to board the Hogwarts Express?
Who is the only known maker of the Philosopher's Stone?
What creature guards the entrance to the Gryffindor common room?
What position does Harry play on the Gryffindor Quidditch team?
What is the name of Hagrid's three-headed dog?
What spell is used to disarm an opponent?
What is the antidote to most poisons?
questions.answer: Bezoar (a stone taken from a goat's stomach)

questions.question: What are the names of Draco Malfoy's two cronies?
What is the name of the pub in Hogsmeade that students frequent?
In what year did the International Statute of Wizarding Secrecy become effective?
What does Professor McGonagall teach at Hogwarts?
How many players are on a Quidditch team?
What creature can only be seen by those who have witnessed death?
What is the incantation for the Patronus Charm?
What potion grants the drinker good luck for a period of time?
questions.answer: Felix Felicis (also known as Liquid Luck)

questions.question: Who is the Half-Blood Prince?
questions.answer: Severus Snape (his mother was Eileen Prince)

questions.question: What is the name of the wizard prison guarded by Dementors?
What are the four Hogwarts houses?
What magical creature's blood can keep you alive, even if you're an inch from death, but at a terrible price?
questions.answer: Unicorn blood (the price is a cursed half-life)

questions.question: What charm is used to levitate objects?
What does the potion Veritaserum do?
questions.answer: Forces the drinker to tell the truth (truth serum)

questions.question: What is the name of Hermione's cat?
What is the name of the joke shop run by Fred and George Weasley?
Who founded Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry?
questions.answer: Godric Gryffindor, Salazar Slytherin, Rowena Ravenclaw, and Helga Hufflepuff (the four founders)

questions.question: What does O.W.L. stand for in the wizarding education system?
questions.answer: Ordinary Wizarding Levels (exams taken in fifth year)

questions.question: How many points is the Golden Snitch worth in Quidditch?
What creature is Aragog?
What are the three Unforgivable Curses?
questions.answer: Avada Kedavra (Killing Curse), Cruciatus Curse (Crucio), and Imperius Curse (Imperio)

questions.question: What is Amortentia?
questions.answer: The most powerful love potion in existence, which causes powerful infatuation or obsession

questions.question: What is Luna Lovegood's father's name and occupation?
questions.answer: Xenophilius Lovegood, editor of The Quibbler magazine

questions.question: What is the name of the bank run by goblins in Diagon Alley?
What were the original names of the Deathly Hallows in 'The Tale of the Three Brothers'?
questions.answer: The Elder Wand, the Resurrection Stone, and the Cloak of Invisibility

questions.question: What password does Harry first use to enter the Gryffindor common room?
What does a Quaffle do in Quidditch?
questions.answer: It's the red ball used by Chasers to score goals through hoops (worth 10 points per goal)

questions.question: What is a Boggart?
questions.answer: A shape-shifting creature that takes the form of a person's worst fear

questions.question: What is the counter-curse to Petrificus Totalus?
What potion does Slughorn use to show his students what Amortentia smells like?
questions.answer: He demonstrates Amortentia itself - it smells different to each person based on what attracts them

questions.question: What is Neville Longbottom's parents' fate?
questions.answer: They were tortured into insanity by Bellatrix Lestrange and other Death Eaters using the Cruciatus Curse, and are permanent residents of St. Mungo's Hospital

questions.question: What room at Hogwarts appears only when a person has real need of it?
questions.answer: The Room of Requirement (also known as the Come and Go Room)

questions.question: Who was the founder of Slytherin House and what caused him to leave Hogwarts?
questions.answer: Salazar Slytherin; he left due to disagreements with the other founders about only accepting pure-blood students

questions.question: What is the name of the Hogwarts caretaker?
What defensive charm did Harry teach Dumbledore's Army?
questions.answer: The Patronus Charm (Expecto Patronum), among others including Shield Charms and Stunning Spells

questions.question: What is a Squib?
questions.answer: A person born to magical parents who has no magical powers themselves

questions.question: What are the three types of balls used in Quidditch and what are they called?
questions.answer: The Quaffle (red ball for scoring), two Bludgers (black balls that try to knock players off brooms), and the Golden Snitch (small golden ball with wings)

questions.question: What creature does Hagrid introduce in his first Care of Magical Creatures class?
What does N.E.W.T. stand for?
questions.answer: Nastily Exhausting Wizarding Tests (advanced exams taken in seventh year)

questions.question: In what century did the famous goblin rebellions occur?
questions.answer: The 18th century (1700s), though there were rebellions in other periods as well

questions.question: What is the charm used to produce water from the tip of a wand?
What are the main ingredients in Polyjuice Potion?
questions.answer: Lacewing flies, leeches, powdered bicorn horn, knotgrass, fluxweed, boomslang skin, and a piece of the person you want to transform into

questions.question: What is Hermione Granger's middle name?
What shop in Diagon Alley sells wands?
Who was the Hogwarts headmaster before Albus Dumbledore?
What is the name of the ghost who teaches History of Magic?
What are the three types of balls used in Quidditch called?
What do you call a non-magical person born to magical parents?
What spell repairs broken objects?
What potion is known as 'Liquid Luck'?
What is the name of Neville Longbottom's toad?
What is the name of the wizarding hospital?
questions.answer: St. Mungo's Hospital for Magical Maladies and Injuries

questions.question: What year was Hogwarts founded?
What subject does Professor Sprout teach?
What is the name of the Quidditch referee in Harry's first year?
What creature guards the vaults at Gringotts?
questions.answer: Dragons (specifically, Ukrainian Ironbellies in the deepest vaults)

questions.question: What spell creates light at the tip of a wand?
What color is Veritaserum?
What is Luna Lovegood's Patronus?
What is the name of the Weasley family home?
Who created the Philosopher's Stone with Nicolas Flamel?
questions.answer: Nicolas Flamel created it himself (though he worked with Dumbledore, he was the sole creator)

questions.question: How many staircases are there in Hogwarts?
What team does Viktor Krum play for?
What is a phoenix's primary magical ability?
questions.answer: They can carry immense loads, their tears have healing powers, and they burst into flame when they die and are reborn from the ashes

questions.question: What spell unlocks doors?
What is Wolfsbane Potion used for?
questions.answer: It allows a werewolf to keep their mind during transformation, preventing them from becoming a dangerous beast

questions.question: Who is the conductor of the Knight Bus?
Where is the entrance to the Ministry of Magic located in London?
What are the names of the four Marauders?
questions.answer: James Potter (Prongs), Sirius Black (Padfoot), Remus Lupin (Moony), and Peter Pettigrew (Wormtail)

questions.question: What does the Hogwarts motto 'Draco Dormiens Nunquam Titillandus' mean?
How long is a Quidditch pitch?
What is a baby owl called in the wizarding world?
What charm protects an area from Muggle intrusion?
What draught causes a deep, dreamless sleep?
What is Ginny Weasley's full first name?
What is the name of the Hog's Head Inn's barman?
Who was the first owner of the Elder Wand according to legend?
What do students study in Arithmancy?
What is the maximum number of players allowed on a Quidditch team during a match?
What creature is Buckbeak?
What spell is the counter-curse to Petrificus Totalus?
questions.answer: Finite Incantatem (or Rennervate in some cases)

questions.question: What does the Pepper-Up Potion cure?
questions.answer: The common cold (though it causes steam to come out of the drinker's ears)

questions.question: What is Professor Dumbledore's full name?
Where is the Leaky Cauldron located?
questions.answer: Charing Cross Road in London (between a bookshop and a record shop)

questions.question: What organization did Albus Dumbledore help found to fight Grindelwald?
questions.answer: He didn't found an organization; he defeated Grindelwald in 1945

questions.question: What is the password to the Prefects' bathroom?
What is the name of the Irish National Quidditch team's mascots?
What creature has the highest Ministry of Magic danger classification (XXXXX)?
questions.answer: Dragons, Acromantulas, Basilisks, and several others share the XXXXX rating
questions.source: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them

questions.question: What spell summons an object to you?
What ingredient must be added to a potion at the exact moment the moon rises for maximum potency?
What spell makes things shrink?
What potion temporarily increases the drinker's strength?
What is the name of Harry and Ginny's youngest son?
Where does the Hogwarts Express depart from in London?
What was the name of the first Triwizard Tournament task?
questions.answer: Retrieving a golden egg from a dragon

questions.question: What class does Professor Flitwick teach?
What position does Ginny Weasley play on the Gryffindor Quidditch team?
questions.answer: Chaser (later Seeker when Harry is unavailable)

questions.question: What creature is Nagini?
questions.answer: A snake (specifically, a Maledictus who became permanently trapped in snake form)

questions.question: What spell extinguishes lights?
What potion allows you to breathe underwater?
questions.answer: Gillyweed (technically a plant, not a potion) or a Breathing Potion

questions.question: Who is the head of Ravenclaw House?
What is the name of the village near Hogwarts that students can visit?
In what year did Lord Voldemort first fall?
What is the name of Hogwarts' gamekeeper before Hagrid?
questions.answer: Ogg (the gamekeeper during Tom Riddle's time)

questions.question: What are the Beaters' job in Quidditch?
questions.answer: To protect their team from Bludgers and aim them toward the opposing team

questions.question: What creature is Fawkes?
What spell reveals invisible ink?
What is the primary ingredient in most healing potions?
What is the name of the Weasley family's owl?
What is the name of the alley where dark wizards shop?
Who founded the Order of the Phoenix?
What is the name of the Hufflepuff ghost?
How many fouls are there in Quidditch?
What is a Dementor's Kiss?
questions.answer: A Dementor sucks out a person's soul, leaving them an empty shell

questions.question: What spell opens locked doors and windows?
What does Skele-Gro do?
What is the name of Draco Malfoy's mother?
What is the address of the Dursley family home?
Who created Horcruxes and documented the process?
questions.answer: While many Dark wizards created them, Herpo the Foul was the first known creator; the process was documented in dark arts books

questions.question: What is the core subject taught by Professor Trelawney?
What is the name of the Quidditch World Cup stadium in the 1994 match?
questions.answer: The Quidditch Trillenium Stadium, located on Dartmoor in England. It was built specifically for the 422nd Quidditch World Cup and could hold up to 100,000 spectators.

questions.question: What creature lives in the Black Lake at Hogwarts?
What spell creates a shield charm?
What is the antidote to the Draught of Living Death?
What is Ron Weasley's middle name?
Where is Grimmauld Place located?
What was the first Horcrux destroyed?
What elective subject involves the study of magical creatures?
What is the name of Cho Chang's house?
What form does Harry Potter's Patronus take?
questions.answer: A stag (the same form as his father's Animagus)

questions.question: What spell causes objects to multiply?
What is the effect of drinking unicorn blood?
questions.answer: It will keep you alive even if near death, but you will have a cursed half-life from that moment on

questions.question: Who is the head of Hufflepuff House?
What shop sells joke items in Diagon Alley?
questions.answer: Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes (also Gambol and Japes)

questions.question: When was the first recorded use of the term 'Mudblood'?
questions.answer: The exact date is not specified, but it's been in use for centuries

questions.question: What portrait guards the Gryffindor common room?
What is the name of the Bulgarian Seeker in the 1994 Quidditch World Cup?
What creature guards the Philosopher's Stone?
questions.answer: Multiple creatures: Fluffy (three-headed dog), Devil's Snare, winged keys, a giant chess set, a troll, logic puzzle with potions, and the Mirror of Erised

questions.question: What spell conjures a mark in the sky used by Death Eaters?
What potion makes the drinker tell the truth?
What spell makes objects invisible?
What is the color of a properly brewed Amortentia?
What is the name of the Weasley twins?
What is the name of the train platform for the Hogwarts Express?
How many Horcruxes did Voldemort create?
questions.answer: Seven (though he intended six, Harry was the unintended seventh)

questions.question: What is the name of the Slytherin ghost?
Who is the Gryffindor Keeper in Harry's fifth year?
What are Nifflers attracted to?
What spell causes the victim's legs to lock together?
What plant is used in the second task of the Triwizard Tournament?
Who killed Dobby the house-elf?
What is the name of Sirius Black's family home?
What was the name of the prophecy about Harry and Voldemort?
questions.answer: The prophecy made by Sybill Trelawney (no specific name given)

questions.question: What is the name of the Ravenclaw ghost?
What is the record for fastest capture of a Golden Snitch?
What creature did Hagrid keep in the Forbidden Forest?
questions.answer: Aragog the Acromantula, along with his family

questions.question: What spell produces a corporeal Patronus?
What is the primary effect of the Confusing Concoction?
questions.answer: It confuses and bewilders the drinker

questions.question: What is the name of Hagrid's half-brother?
Where is the Shrieking Shack located?
Who were the original members of the Triwizard Tournament?
questions.answer: Hogwarts, Beauxbatons, and Durmstrang (the three largest European wizarding schools)

questions.question: What must a student say to open the Marauder's Map?
questions.answer: I solemnly swear that I am up to no good

questions.question: What is the name of Oliver Wood's position on the Quidditch team?
What are Bowtruckles used for?
questions.answer: They guard wand-wood trees and are useful for picking locks

questions.question: What spell creates fire?
What is the Elixir of Life?
questions.answer: A potion created from the Philosopher's Stone that grants immortality

questions.question: What is the name of the Longbottom family's house-elf?
questions.answer: The Longbottoms don't have a house-elf mentioned in the books

questions.question: What is the name of the Department of Mysteries chamber where the prophecies are kept?
Who killed Remus Lupin?
What subject does Professor Slughorn teach?
questions.answer: Potions (later replaced by Snape teaching Defense Against the Dark Arts)

questions.question: What do the Chasers do in Quidditch?
questions.answer: Score goals by throwing the Quaffle through the opponent's hoops

questions.question: What is a Blast-Ended Skrewt?
questions.answer: A dangerous hybrid creature created by Hagrid, part Manticore and part Fire Crab

questions.question: What spell causes objects to levitate and move?
What is the Mandrake Restorative Draught used for?
questions.answer: To restore people who have been petrified or transfigured

questions.question: Who is Moaning Myrtle?
questions.answer: A ghost who haunts the girls' bathroom; she was killed by the Basilisk

questions.question: Where is Azkaban prison located?
questions.answer: On an island in the North Sea

questions.question: What spell did Hermione use to free Harry and Ron from the Devil's Snare?
questions.answer: Lumos Solem (light spell) to drive away the darkness-loving plant

questions.question: What does S.P.E.W. stand for?
questions.answer: Society for the Promotion of Elfish Welfare

questions.question: What is the term for a non-magical person?
What form does Hermione Granger's Patronus take?
What spell erases memories?
What is the purpose of a Bezoar?
questions.answer: It acts as an antidote to most poisons

questions.question: What is Severus Snape's nickname from his school days?
What is the name of the cave where Dumbledore and Harry retrieve a Horcrux?
Who killed Nagini?
questions.answer: Neville Longbottom (using the Sword of Gryffindor)

questions.question: What does D.A. stand for?
What broom does Harry receive in his third year?
What creature can transform into a person's worst fear?
What spell fixes broken glasses?
What does the Forgetfulness Potion do?
questions.answer: Causes memory loss in the drinker

questions.question: What spell makes things explode?
What is the name of the potion that allows you to assume the form of another person?
What is the name of Bill Weasley's wife?
What is the name of the wizarding prison in Britain?
What year did the Battle of Hogwarts take place?
What is the name of Nearly Headless Nick's full title?
What is the name of the move where a Seeker dives steeply?
What form does Ron Weasley's Patronus take?
What spell conjures a snake?
What is the Shrinking Solution used for?
questions.answer: To shrink or de-age living creatures

questions.question: Who is Peeves?
questions.answer: A poltergeist who causes chaos at Hogwarts

questions.question: Where is the entrance to the Chamber of Secrets?
questions.answer: In Moaning Myrtle's bathroom (second floor girls' lavatory)

questions.question: Who was the first victim of the Basilisk in Harry's second year?
questions.answer: Mrs. Norris (Argus Filch's cat) - she was petrified, not killed

questions.question: What is the password used to close the Marauder's Map?
What is the name of the Quidditch team mascot for Bulgaria?
What creature can only be seen by someone who has witnessed death?
What spell binds someone with ropes?
What does the Draught of Peace do?
What is the name of Voldemort's mother?
What is the name of the orphanage where Tom Riddle grew up?
What was the original purpose of Dementors?
questions.answer: They were used to guard Azkaban prison

questions.question: What is the name of the spell used to conjure the Dark Mark?
What is the highest score ever achieved in a Quidditch match?
questions.answer: This is not specified in the books

questions.question: What creature is Crookshanks part of?
questions.source: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them

questions.question: What spell is used to vanish objects?
What does the Invisibility Potion do?
questions.answer: Makes the drinker invisible (though this is rarely mentioned; Invisibility Cloaks are more common)

questions.question: What is the name of Hagrid's boarhound?
What is the name of the tearoom in Hogsmeade?
Who killed Bellatrix Lestrange?
What does R.A.B. stand for?
How many Bludgers are used in a Quidditch match?
What is a Patronus used for?
questions.answer: To repel Dementors and Lethifolds, and can be used for communication

questions.question: What spell creates a protective barrier?
What potion causes boils?
questions.answer: Boil-Cure Potion (ironically, if brewed incorrectly it causes boils)

questions.question: What is the name of Harry's owl?
What is the name of the street where the Leaky Cauldron is located?
Who opened the Chamber of Secrets 50 years before Harry?
What does O.W.L.S. test at Hogwarts?
questions.answer: Ordinary Wizarding Level examinations (taken in fifth year)

questions.question: What is a Golden Snitch made of?
What are house-elves bound by?
questions.answer: Powerful magic that binds them to serve wizarding families

questions.question: What spell is used to write in midair?
questions.answer: There isn't a specific named spell; various charms can create this effect

questions.question: What is Essence of Murtlap used for?
Who is the Potions master after Snape becomes Defense Against the Dark Arts teacher?
What is the name of the inn in Hogsmeade run by Madam Rosmerta?
Who killed Dumbledore?
questions.answer: Severus Snape (though Dumbledore had arranged his own death)

questions.question: What form of magical transportation appears in Harry's third year?
What do you win if you catch the Golden Snitch?
What is a Lethifold?
questions.answer: A deadly creature that looks like a black cloak and suffocates its victims
questions.source: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them

questions.question: What spell creates a bouquet of flowers?
What is the hair-raising potion called?
What spell is used to stun someone?
What is the color of properly brewed Veritaserum?
Who is Tonks' mother?
What is the name of the bridge near Hogwarts?
In what year did the Triwizard Tournament take place at Hogwarts?
What does Professor Trelawney predict for Harry?
What is the name of the England National Quidditch team?
questions.answer: The Wimbourne Wasps (one of British teams; England National team not specifically named)

questions.question: What is a Kneazle?
questions.answer: A magical cat-like creature that can detect untrustworthy people
questions.source: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them

questions.question: What spell produces a silver animal guardian?
What does the Cure for Boils require as an ingredient?
questions.answer: Dried nettles, crushed snake fangs, stewed horned slugs, and porcupine quills

questions.question: Who is the driver of the Knight Bus?
Where does Fleur Delacour come from?
Who was the first Muggle-born sorted into Slytherin in recent history?
questions.answer: This is not explicitly stated in the books (traditionally pure-bloods only)

questions.question: What is the Room of Requirement also known as?
What happens when you catch the Golden Snitch?
questions.answer: The game ends and your team gains 150 points

questions.question: What do Grindylows look like?
questions.answer: Small, horned water demons with sharp teeth and long fingers

questions.question: What spell mends broken bones?
questions.answer: Episkey (for minor injuries; serious breaks require Skele-Gro potion)

questions.question: What does the Babbling Beverage do?
questions.answer: Causes the drinker to babble nonsense

questions.question: What is the name of Sirius Black's mother?
What is the name of the wizarding village in Scotland near Hogwarts?
Who founded Durmstrang Institute?
questions.answer: The school's founder is not named in the books

questions.question: What must you do to enter the Hufflepuff common room?
questions.answer: Tap the barrel two from the bottom, middle of the second row, to the rhythm of 'Helga Hufflepuff'

questions.question: What is the diameter of a Quidditch goal hoop?
What form does Cho Chang's Patronus take?
What spell makes objects fly through the air?
What is the Burning Bitterroot Balm used for?
Who is Cornelius Fudge?
questions.answer: The Minister of Magic (before Rufus Scrimgeour)

questions.question: What is the name of the shop that sells Quidditch supplies in Diagon Alley?
Who was the original owner of the Resurrection Stone?
How many times must you walk past the Room of Requirement thinking about what you need?
How many substitutes are allowed on a Quidditch team?
questions.answer: No specific number is mentioned in the books

questions.question: What are Dementors?
questions.answer: Dark creatures that feed on human happiness and can suck out souls

questions.question: What spell reveals hidden magical objects?
questions.answer: Homenum Revelio (reveals humans) or Specialis Revelio (reveals magical concealment)

questions.question: What is in the Wit-Sharpening Potion?
questions.answer: Ginger root, armadillo bile, and scarab beetles (among other ingredients)

questions.question: What is Madam Pomfrey's first name?
Where is Beauxbatons Academy located?
Who created the Fidelius Charm for the Potters?
questions.answer: The charm's caster is not specified (likely Dumbledore or another powerful wizard)

questions.question: What is the maximum capacity of the Great Hall?
questions.answer: This is not specified in the books

questions.question: What is the name of Ginny Weasley's Pygmy Puff?
What is a Runespoor?
questions.answer: A three-headed serpent native to Burkina Faso
questions.source: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them

questions.question: What spell can deflect physical and magical attacks?
What does the Elixir to Induce Euphoria do?
questions.answer: Creates a sense of extreme happiness and euphoria

questions.question: Who is the Bloody Baron in love with?
What is the address of Grimmauld Place?
When was Harry Potter born?
What is the name of the secret organization Dumbledore founded?
What broom company makes the Nimbus 2000?
What does Hermione's Patronus represent about her personality?
questions.answer: An otter - playful, intelligent, and loyal (otters are known for being clever and social)

questions.question: What spell removes curses from objects?
What is Pepperup Potion's side effect?
questions.answer: Steam comes out of the drinker's ears for several hours

questions.question: What spell creates a bandage?
What is Amortentia used for?
questions.answer: It's the most powerful love potion, creating powerful infatuation (not actual love)

questions.question: What is Kreacher?
Where is Durmstrang Institute located?
questions.answer: Northern Europe (exact location unknown, possibly Scandinavia)

questions.question: What was the original name of the Shrieking Shack's purpose?
questions.answer: It was built for Remus Lupin's werewolf transformations

questions.question: What is the Ravenclaw common room password system?
questions.answer: Answer a riddle posed by an eagle-shaped door knocker

questions.question: What does a Quaffle look like?
questions.answer: A red leather ball about 12 inches in diameter

questions.question: What form does Dumbledore's Patronus take?
What spell conjures birds?
What ingredient is essential in the Wolfsbane Potion?
Who is Olympe Maxime?
questions.answer: Headmistress of Beauxbatons Academy (and a half-giant)

questions.question: What is the name of the cemetery where Voldemort was reborn?
What was Voldemort's mother's maiden name?
What is the entrance to the Slytherin common room?
questions.answer: A bare stretch of stone wall in the dungeons that opens with a password

questions.question: What is the maximum height a broomstick can reach?
questions.answer: This is not specified in the books

questions.question: What is a Graphorn?
questions.answer: A large, aggressive creature with two golden horns and grayish purple skin
questions.source: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them

questions.question: What spell creates ropes to bind someone?
What does the Ageing Potion do?
Who is Winky?
questions.answer: A house-elf formerly belonging to the Crouch family

questions.question: What is the name of the cave where Harry and Sirius hide Buckbeak?
questions.answer: A cave on the mountain overlooking Hogsmeade (no specific name given)

questions.question: Who were the three Peverell brothers?
What are the Hogwarts house colors for Gryffindor?
What happens if you release a Bludger during a Quidditch match?
questions.answer: It tries to knock players off their brooms (that's its intended purpose)

questions.question: What form does Snape's Patronus take?
questions.answer: A doe (the same as Lily Potter's)

questions.question: What spell is used to cure minor injuries?
What does the Beautification Potion do?
questions.answer: Temporarily makes the drinker more beautiful

questions.question: Who is Kingsley Shacklebolt?
questions.answer: An Auror and member of the Order of the Phoenix (later Minister of Magic)

questions.question: What is the name of the forest near Hogwarts?
Who killed Hedwig?
questions.answer: A Death Eater during the Battle of the Seven Potters

questions.question: What are the Hogwarts house colors for Slytherin?
What is the oldest broomstick racing competition?
What is a Quintaped?
questions.answer: A dangerous five-legged carnivorous creature native to the Isle of Drear
questions.source: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them

questions.question: What spell is used to pack a trunk?
What does the Draught of Peace contain?
questions.answer: Powdered moonstone, syrup of hellebore, and various other ingredients

questions.question: Who is Mundungus Fletcher?
questions.answer: A member of the Order of the Phoenix and a petty criminal/dealer

questions.question: What is Shell Cottage?
questions.answer: Bill and Fleur Weasley's home by the sea

questions.question: When did Tom Riddle open the Chamber of Secrets for the first time?
What are the Hogwarts house colors for Ravenclaw?
questions.answer: Blue and bronze (blue and silver in the films)

questions.question: What is a Keeper's role in Quidditch?
questions.answer: To guard the goal hoops and prevent the opposing team from scoring

questions.question: What is a Horklump?
questions.answer: A mushroom-like creature that infests gardens
questions.source: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them

questions.question: What spell removes specific sections of memory?
What is the primary use of flobberworm mucus?
questions.answer: As a thickening agent in potions

questions.question: Who is Bathilda Bagshot?
questions.answer: A magical historian, author of 'A History of Magic'

questions.question: What is Godric's Hollow?
questions.answer: A wizarding village where the Potters lived and where Harry's parents were killed

questions.question: Who won the Triwizard Tournament?
questions.answer: Officially Harry Potter and Cedric Diggory tied, though Cedric was killed

questions.question: What are the Hogwarts house colors for Hufflepuff?
How fast can a Firebolt broomstick go?
What form does Kingsley Shacklebolt's Patronus take?
What spell allows objects to fly?
questions.answer: Mobilicorpus (for bodies) or Wingardium Leviosa (for objects)

questions.question: What does the Invigoration Draught do?
What spell creates a flock of canaries?
What is Sleeping Draught used for?
Who is Rufus Scrimgeour?
questions.answer: Minister of Magic after Cornelius Fudge

questions.question: What is Spinner's End?
questions.answer: The street where Severus Snape grew up

questions.question: How many Death Eaters broke out of Azkaban in 1996?
What does Peeves do at Hogwarts?
questions.answer: Causes chaos and mischief (he's a poltergeist)

questions.question: What color is the Snitch?
What form does Ginny Weasley's Patronus take?
What spell seals an object shut?
What is the Hate Potion?
questions.answer: A potion that creates feelings of hatred (rarely mentioned)

questions.question: Who is Horace Slughorn?
questions.answer: Potions Master at Hogwarts (returned in Harry's sixth year)

questions.question: What is the Cave?
questions.answer: The seaside cave where Voldemort hid Slytherin's locket Horcrux

questions.question: When did the first wizarding war end?
How many towers does Hogwarts have?
questions.answer: Multiple towers, but the exact number is not specified

questions.question: What are the dimensions of a Quidditch pitch?
What is a Jarvey?
questions.answer: A creature resembling an overgrown ferret that can speak (usually rude)
questions.source: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them

questions.question: What spell detects humans nearby?
What is Blood-Replenishing Potion?
questions.answer: A potion that restores blood after blood loss

questions.question: Who is Madam Pince?
Where is the Hog's Head Inn located?
Who killed Fred Weasley?
questions.answer: Augustus Rookwood (Death Eater) during the Battle of Hogwarts

questions.question: What is the Hogwarts school motto?
questions.answer: Draco Dormiens Nunquam Titillandus (Never Tickle a Sleeping Dragon)

questions.question: What are the three goal hoops in Quidditch?
questions.answer: Three hoops at each end of the pitch (50 feet high)

questions.question: What form does Aberforth Dumbledore's Patronus take?
What spell causes vomiting?
questions.answer: There isn't a specific named spell; various jinxes can cause this

questions.question: What is Dreamless Sleep Potion?
questions.answer: A potion that provides deep, dreamless sleep

questions.question: Who is Pius Thicknesse?
questions.answer: Head of Magical Law Enforcement, later puppet Minister under Voldemort's control

questions.question: What is Malfoy Manor?
questions.answer: The Malfoy family estate in Wiltshire

questions.question: What was the original owner of the Cloak of Invisibility?
What year was Hogwarts founded approximately?
What is a Portkey?
questions.answer: An enchanted object used for magical transportation

questions.question: What is a Flobberworm?
questions.answer: A ten-inch brown worm that produces mucus used in potions

questions.question: What spell causes intense pain?
What does the Memory Potion do?
Who is Yaxley?
questions.answer: A Death Eater who worked at the Ministry of Magic

questions.question: What is the Riddle House?
questions.answer: The old home of Tom Riddle Sr. in Little Hangleton

questions.question: When was Dumbledore born?
What is the Gryffindor common room like?
questions.answer: A cozy, circular room with scarlet armchairs and a fireplace

questions.question: What is a Comet Two Sixty?
questions.answer: A model of broomstick (older, slower model)

questions.question: What form does McGonagall's Patronus take?
What spell makes someone laugh uncontrollably?
What is the Laugh-Inducing Potion?
questions.answer: A potion that causes uncontrollable laughter

questions.question: Who is Madam Malkin?
questions.answer: The owner of a robe shop in Diagon Alley

questions.question: What is the Shrieking Shack?
questions.answer: An allegedly haunted house in Hogsmeade (built for Lupin's transformations)

questions.question: Who was the youngest Seeker in a century?
How many students attend Hogwarts?
What is a Cleansweep Eleven?
What is a Demiguise?
questions.answer: A peaceful, ape-like creature that can become invisible
questions.source: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them

questions.question: What spell sends objects flying backward?
What is the antidote for basilisk venom?
What spell creates a shield?
What is the Hiccoughing Solution?
Who is Dedalus Diggle?
questions.answer: A member of the Order of the Phoenix, known for bowing to Harry

questions.question: What is Gringotts?
questions.answer: The wizarding bank run by goblins in Diagon Alley

questions.question: Who were Harry's parents?
What house was Cedric Diggory in?
What is a Snitch?
questions.answer: A small golden ball with wings that the Seeker must catch

questions.question: What is a Puffskein?
questions.answer: A small, fluffy magical creature that's a popular pet
questions.source: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them

questions.question: What spell enlarges objects?
What is the Regeneration Potion?
questions.answer: A potion used to restore physical form (used by Voldemort)

questions.question: Who is Elphias Doge?
questions.answer: A member of the Order of the Phoenix and friend of Dumbledore

questions.question: What is Azkaban?
questions.answer: The wizard prison guarded by Dementors

questions.question: When did Voldemort return to power?
What are the four Hogwarts founders' first names?
What is a Beater's job?
questions.answer: To hit Bludgers away from teammates and toward opponents

questions.question: What is an Occamy?
questions.answer: A plumed, two-legged winged creature that can grow or shrink to fit space
questions.source: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them

questions.question: What spell reveals someone's location on a map?
questions.answer: The Marauder's Map uses complex magic (no single spell named)

questions.question: What is the Swelling Solution?
questions.answer: A potion that causes whatever it touches to swell

questions.question: Who is Emmeline Vance?
questions.answer: A member of the Order of the Phoenix

questions.question: What is St. Mungo's?
questions.answer: The wizarding hospital (full name: St. Mungo's Hospital for Magical Maladies and Injuries)

questions.question: Who killed Voldemort?
questions.answer: His own rebounded Killing Curse (Harry was the catalyst)

questions.question: What is Dumbledore's favorite flavor of jam?
What is a Chaser?
questions.answer: A Quidditch player who scores goals with the Quaffle

questions.question: What form does Seamus Finnigan's Patronus take?
What spell produces a jet of water?
What is the Burn-Healing Paste?
Who is Hestia Jones?
questions.answer: A member of the Order of the Phoenix

questions.question: What is Flourish and Blotts?
What was Voldemort's real name?
What does the Sorting Hat do?
questions.answer: Sorts first-year students into their Hogwarts houses

questions.question: What happens if a Seeker catches the Snitch?
questions.answer: The match ends and their team gets 150 points

questions.question: What is a Moke?
questions.answer: A silver-green lizard that can shrink at will
questions.source: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them

questions.question: What spell makes things disappear?
What is the Poison Antidote?
questions.answer: Various antidotes exist; Bezoar is a general antidote

questions.question: Who is Sturgis Podmore?
questions.answer: A member of the Order of the Phoenix

questions.question: What is Borgin and Burkes?
questions.answer: A dark artifacts shop in Knockturn Alley

questions.question: When did Harry first visit Diagon Alley?
What class does Professor Binns teach?
What is a Bludger?
questions.answer: A black iron ball that tries to knock players off brooms

questions.question: What form does Neville Longbottom's Patronus take?
What spell creates darkness?
questions.answer: Peruvian Instant Darkness Powder (not a spell, but a product)

questions.question: What is the Calming Draught?
questions.answer: A potion that calms the drinker

questions.question: Who is Arthur Weasley?
questions.answer: Ron's father, works at the Ministry of Magic in the Misuse of Muggle Artifacts Office

questions.question: What is the Leaky Cauldron?
questions.answer: A wizarding pub and inn that serves as the entrance to Diagon Alley

questions.question: What year did Harry start at Hogwarts?
What does the Hogwarts Express look like?
What are the Quidditch goal posts called?
What is a Chimera?
questions.answer: A rare Greek monster with a lion's head, goat's body, and dragon's tail
questions.source: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them

questions.question: What spell immobilizes someone?
What is the Grand Wiggenweld Potion?
Who is Molly Weasley?
questions.answer: Ron's mother, a member of the Order of the Phoenix

questions.question: What is Diagon Alley?
questions.answer: A wizarding shopping street in London

questions.question: What happened on Halloween 1981?
questions.answer: Voldemort killed the Potters and tried to kill Harry

questions.question: How do students travel to Hogwarts?
questions.answer: On the Hogwarts Express from Platform 9Â¾

questions.question: What are the Quidditch balls?
questions.answer: The Quaffle, two Bludgers, and the Golden Snitch

questions.question: What is a Nundu?
questions.answer: A giant leopard-like creature with toxic breath, native to East Africa
questions.source: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them

questions.question: What spell silences someone?
What is the Draught of Living Death?
Who is Percy Weasley?
questions.answer: Ron's ambitious older brother who works at the Ministry

questions.question: What is Knockturn Alley?
questions.answer: A dark and dangerous shopping area off Diagon Alley

questions.question: When did the second wizarding war begin?
What subjects are taught at Hogwarts?
questions.answer: Potions, Charms, Transfiguration, DADA, Herbology, Astronomy, History of Magic, and electives

questions.question: What is the Quidditch World Cup?
questions.answer: An international Quidditch tournament held every four years

questions.question: What is an Erumpent?
questions.answer: A large African beast resembling a rhinoceros with explosive horn
questions.source: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them

questions.question: What spell reverses minor jinxes?
What is the Wideye Potion?
questions.answer: A potion that prevents sleep and keeps the drinker awake

questions.question: Who is Charlie Weasley?
questions.answer: Ron's older brother who works with dragons in Romania

questions.question: What is Hogsmeade?
questions.answer: The only all-wizarding village in Britain, near Hogwarts

questions.question: When did Dumbledore die?
What are the seven Horcruxes?
questions.answer: Diary, Ring, Locket, Cup, Diadem, Nagini, and Harry (unintentional)

questions.question: What is the Triwizard Tournament?
questions.answer: A magical contest between three wizarding schools

questions.question: What is a Fire Crab?
questions.answer: A turtle-like creature with a jeweled shell that shoots flames

questions.question: What spell reveals the last spell cast by a wand?
What is Felix Felicis?
questions.answer: Liquid Luck - a potion that makes the drinker lucky

questions.question: Who is Dean Thomas?
questions.answer: A Gryffindor student in Harry's year

questions.question: What is the Ministry of Magic?
questions.answer: The governing body of the magical community in Britain

questions.question: When was the second wizarding war?
questions.source: Order of the Phoenix through Deathly Hallows

questions.question: What is the Great Hall?
questions.answer: The main dining hall at Hogwarts with enchanted ceiling

questions.question: What country won the 1994 Quidditch World Cup?
What is a Manticore?
questions.answer: A dangerous creature with a human head, lion's body, and scorpion tail
questions.source: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them

questions.question: What spell creates sparks?
What is Amortentia?
questions.answer: The most powerful love potion in existence

questions.question: Who is Lavender Brown?
questions.answer: A Gryffindor student in Harry's year (briefly dated Ron)

questions.question: What is the Department of Mysteries?
questions.answer: A secretive department in the Ministry of Magic

questions.question: What are the Deathly Hallows?
questions.answer: The Elder Wand, Resurrection Stone, and Cloak of Invisibility

questions.question: What is the Forbidden Forest?
questions.answer: A dark forest on Hogwarts grounds, home to many dangerous creatures

questions.question: What are the four Quidditch positions?
What is a Fwooper?
questions.answer: A brightly colored African bird whose song drives listeners mad
questions.source: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them

questions.question: What spell kills?
What is Veritaserum?
questions.answer: Truth serum - forces the drinker to tell the truth

questions.question: Who is Parvati Patil?
questions.answer: A Gryffindor student in Harry's year (twin of Padma)

questions.question: What is the Room of Requirement?
questions.answer: A magical room that appears when someone needs it

questions.question: What is a Horcrux?
questions.answer: An object containing a piece of someone's soul

questions.question: What are the Hogwarts house traits?
questions.answer: Gryffindor: bravery, Slytherin: ambition, Ravenclaw: intelligence, Hufflepuff: loyalty

questions.question: What happens when you score in Quidditch?
questions.answer: Your team gets 10 points (for Quaffle through hoops)

questions.question: What is a Basilisk?
questions.answer: A giant serpent that can kill with its gaze

questions.question: What spell controls people?
What is Polyjuice Potion?
questions.answer: A potion that allows you to take the form of another person

questions.question: Who is Seamus Finnigan?
questions.answer: A Gryffindor student in Harry's year, known for explosions

questions.question: What is the Chamber of Secrets?
questions.answer: A hidden chamber at Hogwarts created by Salazar Slytherin
